newsitem.title: USA: NY precious metals seen opening slightly higher.
newsitem.headline: NY precious metals seen opening slightly higher.

text.p: New York precious metals futures were called to open slightly higher Thursday, in line with the bullion market which continued its slow recovery from a month long downtrend overnight.
COMEX December gold was called unchanged to up $0.50 from Wednesday's close of $383.50 an ounce. It traded in a $383.50 to $384.10 range on ACCESS.
In New York bullion trade, spot gold was quoted early at $381.50/382.00 versus the London morning fix of $381.60 and Wednesday's close here at $381.00/50.
COMEX gold stocks fell 32,867 ounces Wednesday to 1,066,822 ounces, the 11th straight day of falls in gold warehouse stocks.
COMEX December silver was called unchanged to up 1.0 cent from Wednesday's close of $4.973. It traded a $4.960 to $4.985 range on ACCESS.
COMEX silver stocks, excluding Wilmington Trust silver stocks, fell a further 3,844,320 ounces Wednesday to 137,631,324 ounces, setting a fresh low for the year.
NYMEX January platinum was expected to open unchanged to up $0.50 from Wednesday's close of $391.20, with NYMEX December palladium called little changed from Wednesday's finish of $118.50.
